result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Lee Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Lee Jones in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for James Lee Jones.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-26-2022

Defendant James Lee Jones in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for James Lee Jones.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-27-2022

Defendant James Lee Jones in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for James Lee Jones.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date. Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-30-2022

Defendant James Lee Jones in court in person with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia who appears by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Michael Cerniglia
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 07-19-2022

Defendant James Lee Jones in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be transferred to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 06-15-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.   No driving at all. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.   Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.

Defendant James Lee Jones in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant James Lee Jones in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Lee Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
